notes.note: You can now view PDF documents as you browse, no need to download them and open external applications anymore for this frequent use case.

[Total Cookie Protection][1] was added to Enhanced Tracking Protection’s Strict Mode. With Total Cookie Protection, every website gets its own “cookie jar,” [preventing cookies from being used to track you from site to site][2].

[1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/security/2021/02/23/total-cookie-protection/
[2]: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enhanced-tracking-protection-firefox-android#w_total-cookie-protection

On Pixel devices running Android 12 or higher, you can now [share links][1] to recently viewed web content directly from the Recents screen. After visiting the content in an app, you can swipe to the Recents screen and find the app where they viewed the content, then tap on the link button to copy or share the URL.

[1]: https://developer.android.com/guide/components/activities/recents#url-sharing

Firefox is making a security change in how Open in app and Android intents behave. You will need to confirm that the request to Open in app is expected. We will be working to refine and improve this change in upcoming releases.
Fixed a case on Android 13 when copying a password from your Firefox logins the clipboard preview will hide your password.
Fixed a case where a white bar will be shown at the bottom of the screen when scrolling and the toolbar bar is set to top.
Fixed a crash when interacting with the media playback notification in the notification drawer.
